data.text: @ScotsFootyCards Aye but all you get these days is the edited down 60 minute version. The full 90 minute version is the mutts nuts!
@DaveTilley2 @ScotsFootyCards Where to start? I have  bored my family ad nauseam over the years with 3rd rate impersonations of both, works of genius.
@ScotsFootyCards It is genius from start to finish
@ScotsFootyCards For me it's only this and the great Richard Pryor stand up movie, everything else is second best.
@ScotsFootyCards Found him funny till he told the world his neebors from his birth country were useless shites. Didnt find him funny after that.
@ScotsFootyCards I'm starting to doubt I've seen more than the hour.
@gjp1969 The hour edit is what's out there and what was shown on the telly after. Took me ages to get the full show.
@ScotsFootyCards I'm sure it was. I've watched it so many times when I'm flicking through channels that the hour edit is what has stuck
@gjp1969 @TomBrogan haha - Jimmy Tarbuck pissing himself at that.
@ScotsFootyCards @TomBrogan Half man half horse. License to shit in the street 😂
@gjp1969 I'm sure the full thing was what was shown when it was originally on the telly.
@TomBrogan "I'll.... I'll take you home in a minute...." 😂😂

@ScotsFootyCards Definitely seen the full thing but would love to see it again. Still occasionally listen to some of his old albums like Billy and Albert on vinyl. Used to have a few cassettes from his folk singing days with comedy bits between songs. Gutted I can't find them. My loft is a cave
@ScotsFootyCards Yes, for me too. Such an original idea. The visual aspect as well. The laughs when he mimes tying them up. He totally paints a picture.
@TomBrogan *Incontinence
@Fitba_Stadiums haha - cut to Denis Law!
@TomBrogan As difficult as it is picking out the best part of it, if I was pushed I'd have to say the Incontenance Knickers one. Utterly brilliant.

@ScotsFootyCards "Scotland always qualify. You have to try and remember the year"

Ahhhh, the good old days
@Fitba_Stadiums Never regret it.

@TomBrogan I remember watching it the first time it was on with all my family. There's so much to associate with about what he says.I really can't say more than I think it's the best comedic performance I've ever seen.
@ScotsFootyCards Thank you. An audience with Billy Connolly is going on right now.
@ScotsFootyCards It's an absolute all time great comedy special. I think that was obvious from first viewing, and still delivers today.

@TomBrogan For me, it's one of those things that I love introducing to someone for the first time - like Life of Brian or Spinal Tap. I take so much pleasure from being there while people experience it for the first time
@gjp1969 Thing is, the version you've seen is probably the short version. There's a longer version that I've got on DVD. I'll see if I can get it uploaded.

@ScotsFootyCards Watched it again a few weeks ago when I was about to go to bed and saw it had just started on ITV4 or somewhere. Still holds up. Doesn't seem dated or out of touch, nor does it have targets, like a lot of comedy from that or indeed more recent eras.

@ScotsFootyCards I'd put it as probably my favourite hour of tv ever. Watched again a couple of weeks ago. Still hilarious. The celebrity audience in tears adds to it. I do reckon Harry Campbell and The Heavies could have made the top 10 though.
